ngiemboon: Ábalam pɔ́ nzwě we Salayi la te múɔ zyé. Salayi la gẅiin nkwɔɔn ye, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Agaa, á gwɔ́ múɔ Egíbtò.
en: Abram’s wife, Sarai, had not borne any children for him, but she owned an Egyptian slave named Hagar.

ngiemboon: Salayi gɔɔn né Ábalam ngie: «Gyá jú páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kaa zẅíŋ páʼ ngwɔ́ n zyé múɔ wɔ́, shúshu, pi nkwɔɔn yɔɔn nuŋe, ngwɔ́ n dáʼ ńzẅɛ́ʼ pɔ́ yé tá ńgẅiin múɔ.» Ábalam júʼu nò gie Salayi gɔ̌ɔn.
en: Sarai said to Abram, “Since the Lord has prevented me from bearing children, go to my slave; perhaps through her I can build a family.” And Abram agreed to what Sarai said.

ngiemboon: Salayi gwaa náa Agaa múɔ Egíbtò gẅie á laa ngàŋafàʼ we wemanzwě á mbwó ndúm we Ábalam púʼu, mbà Ábalam tsẅě ngwòŋ Kánàhan ngùʼ legém.
en: So Abram’s wife, Sarai, took Hagar, her Egyptian slave, and gave her to her husband, Abram, as a wife for him. This happened after Abram had lived in the land of Canaan ten years.

ngiemboon: Ábalam pɔ́ Agaa nuŋe, Agaa shwoŋ, ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńzsé ngie aa shwoŋ, ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńdíe máfàʼ we pɔ́ tepòŋ.
en: He slept with   Hagar, and she became pregnant. When she saw that she was pregnant, her mistress became contemptible to her.

ngiemboon: Salayi leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Ábalam ngie: «Wɔɔn mánẅìle gẅie Agaa lɔgɔ ńkúu wɔ́ɔn lɔɔn, à fóo né gù. Kwàʼ mèŋ zɔ ka gɔɔn ngie pi ngàŋafàʼ wɔ̀ɔn nuŋe. À lěen ńgyá tà ńgwɔ́ shwoŋ, n cʉ́ʼʉ tsɔ́ mmó mbwó yé wɔ́. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ ge zsé páʼ à ge záʼ ntsaŋ yɔ̀gɔ púʼu.»
en: Then Sarai said to Abram, “You are responsible for my suffering!   I put my slave in your arms,  # 16:5 Lit bosom and when she saw that she was pregnant, I became contemptible to her. May the Lord judge between me and you.”  # 16:5 Gn 31:49; Jos 22:25; 1Sm 24:12

ngiemboon: Ábalam tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó Salayi ngie: «Ee nkwɔɔn jù, gù zɔ gẅiin nò ńnáa na yé, gÿo páʼ ɔ̀ zsě na yé.» Á cʉa púʼu, Salayi náa Agaa ngɔ́ʼ nǎ tà á gwáʼa yé ńkÿo.
en: Abram replied to Sarai, “Here, your slave is in your power; do whatever you want with her.” Then Sarai mistreated her so much that she ran away from her.

ngiemboon: Mántúm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gyá yé ngʉ̀ŋe tsɔ́ sáʼa ntse gie áa na mánzsè láʼa Shûu, á tsɛ̀ɛ kwòŋotsẅɛ.
en: The angel of the Lord    found her by a spring in the wilderness, the spring on the way to Shur.

ngiemboon: Ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Agaa, ngàŋafàʼ Salayi, ɔ̀ fóo né nzɔ̌? Ńgee né nzɔ̌?» Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «N gwaʼá máfàʼ wɔ̀ɔn Salayi, ńkÿo.»
en: He said, “Hagar, slave of Sarai, where have you come from and where are you going? ”

ngiemboon: «Mántúm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: “Piŋ nzèm, ńtsɛ́ɛ máfàʼ gù. Ḿbiŋ ńjúʼ ncwò wé.”
en: The angel of the Lord said to her, “Go back to your mistress and submit to her authority.”

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo gÿo ngẅɛ̀ jù gyɔ́ɔn tà lesáŋ legwɔ́ wó wɔ́. Ńtí nue e ge láʼ gyɔ́ɔn tɛʼ.
en: The angel of the Lord said to her, “I will greatly multiply your offspring,   and they will be too many to count.”

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ wɛ̂ ńgwɔ́ shwoŋ, ɔ̀ ge gÿo zyé tàʼ múɔ mbàŋa, é tsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Esemayɛ̂ɛ, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: “E Ssé jǔʼ.” Ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka júʼ páʼ ɔ̀ gaʼte.
en: The angel of the Lord said to her, “You have conceived and will have a son. You will name him Ishmael,   for the Lord has heard your cry of affliction.

ngiemboon: Míŋ gù ŋwɛ́ ge gÿo gwɔ́ páʼ nzikáasè mbàʼ, à ge gÿo lÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a metsèm lé ncù, epʉ̀a metsèm piŋ ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ yé lé ncù. À ge láʼa tsẅé gíle yé, á jʉʼ gie mefɛ̌ pé té wó wɔ́.»
en: This man will be like a wild donkey. His hand will be against everyone, and everyone’s hand will be against him; he will settle near all his relatives.”

ngiemboon: Agaa mɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tà mèŋ n gee páʼɔɔn mbà mèŋ n gyá nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńgyá wɔ́ɔn lá?» Ńdeen ńké ńná lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à gɔ̌ɔn nò né yé lê: «Ɛɛ-Loyi,» ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: É Ssé gie e ne ńgyá wɔ́ɔn.
en: So she named the Lord who spoke to her: “You are El-roi,”   for she said, “In this place, have I actually seen  # 16:13 Gn 32:30; Ex 33:23; Ps 139:1–12 the one who sees me? ”  # 16:13 Hb obscure

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo mé tóŋ ntse ntǔŋ ŋwɛ́ gẅie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ Kandɛ́shÿè pɔ́ Mbelɛd lê ntse ntǔŋ Lahayi-Loyi, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie ntse ntǔŋ Ssé gie e ne ńgyá wɔ́ɔn.
en: That is why the well is called Beer-lahai-roi.   It is between Kadesh and Bered.

ngiemboon: Agaa pɔ́ Ábalam zyé tàʼ múɔ mbàŋa, Ábalam ná lezíŋ sé lê Esemayɛ̂ɛ.
en: So Hagar gave birth to Abram’s son, and Abram named his son (whom Hagar bore) Ishmael.

ngiemboon: Agaa la gwaa zyé Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Ábalam, mbà Ábalam gẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ lé móm lefɔ̌ɔn.
en: Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to him.
